Detailed Description

The AGC Setting Interface.

Voice Gain

User can set up the volumes of the speaker and microphone by call the function of rtk_SetVoiceGain

Example: Set the channel 0 for 0dB speaker and microphone: 

 
rtk_SetVoiceGain(0, 0, 0);

AGC(Automatic Gain Control)

AGC(Automatic gain control) is a feature that deals with the fact that the volume may vary by a large amount between different users. The AGC provides a way to adjust a signal to a reference volume. This is useful for voice over IP because it removes the need for manual adjustment of the voice gain.

Example: Enable the channel 0 Speaker agc target -25dB, max gain 6dB, min gain -6dB, adaptive threshold -55 dB : 

 
rtk_SetSpkAgc(0, 1, 55);
rtk_SetSpkAgcLvl(0, 0);
rtk_SetSpkAgcGup(0, 5);
rtk_SetSpkAgcGdown(0, 5);
The corresponding functions of microphone are the same as speaker.

AGC(Automatic gain control) Exapmle

Notes: disable AGC in fax or modem application.

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_SetVoiceGain ( uint32  chid,
int  spk_gain,
int  mic_gain 
)

Set the speaker and mic voice gain.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
spk_gainspeaker gain
Available range: -32~31
Mute: -32
Default: 0dB
Unit:dB
Step:1dB
mic_gainmicrophone gain
Available range: -32~31
Mute: -32
Default: 0dB
Unit:dB
Step:1dB
Note
The speaker gain/Mic gain means that the direction of the voice to PCM/RTP.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
custom_tone.c, fxo.c, gain_test.c, and phone.c.
int32 rtk_SetSpkAgc ( uint32  chid,
uint32  support_gain,
uint32  adaptive_threshold 
)

Set the speaker AGC(Automatic gain control) enable/disable.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
support_gainThe support_gain
0: Disable
1: Enable
Default: 0
adaptive_thresholdThe adaptive threshold
Available range: 0 to 70 (0 ~ -70dB)
Unit: dB
Default: 55
Return values
0Success
Examples:
gain_test.c.
int32 rtk_SetSpkAgcLvl ( uint32  chid,
uint32  level 
)

Set the speaker AGC(Automatic gain control) target level.

The AGC will apply an appropriate gain to the input signal in order to achieve this desired output level.
Target level: This is the desired average level of the output signal. (9 target levels are available)
The AGC aims to keep a constant recording or playing volume irrespective of the input signal level.
This is achieved by setting the AGC target level, gain-up and gain-down.
If the input is loud, the gain (gain-down) is turned down.
If the input is soft, the gain (gain-up) is turned up.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
levelThe target level of the speaker
Available range: 0~8
Unit: dB
Step: 3dB
Default: 0
  
     level  target level
       0       -25 dB
       1       -22 dB
       2       -19 dB
       3       -16 dB
       4       -13 dB
       5       -10 dB
       6        -7 dB
       7        -4 dB
       8        -1 dB
Note
It is necessary to target level for the threshold when the signal level after the gain-up compensation is greater than the target level.
It is necessary to target level for the threshold when the signal level after the gain-down compensation is less than the target level.
For example:
One signal level(-15dB), gain-up=5dB, target level=-13dB
After gain compensation, the processed signal should be -10dB but obviously it is greater than the target level.
Because the maximum level is the target level, the the processed signal level will not greater than the target level.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
gain_test.c.
int32 rtk_SetSpkAgcGup ( uint32  chid,
uint32  gain 
)

Set the speaker AGC(Automatic gain control) max gain up.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
gainThe max gain up of speaker
Available range: 0~8
Unit: dB
Step: 1dB
Default: 5
      gain   gain-up
       0      1 dB
       1      2 dB
       2      3 dB
       3      4 dB
       4      5 dB
       5      6 dB
       6      7 dB
       7      8 dB
       8      9 dB
Return values
0Success
Examples:
gain_test.c.

       2      -3 dB

       5      -6 dB

int32 rtk_SetMicAgcLvl ( uint32  chid,
uint32  level 
)

Set the MIC AGC(Automatic gain control) target level.

The AGC will apply an appropriate gain to the input signal in order to achieve this desired output level.
Target level: This is the desired average level of the output signal. (9 target levels are available)
The AGC aims to keep a constant recording or playing volume irrespective of the input signal level.
This is achieved by setting the AGC target level, gain-up and gain-down.
If the input is loud, the gain (gain-down) is turned down.
If the input is soft, the gain (gain-up) is turned up.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
levelThe target level of the microphone
Available range: 0~8
Unit: dB
Step: 3dB
Default: 0
  
     level  target level
       0       -25 dB
       1       -22 dB
       2       -19 dB
       3       -16 dB
       4       -13 dB
       5       -10 dB
       6        -7 dB
       7        -4 dB
       8        -1 dB
Note
It is necessary to target level for the threshold when the signal level after the gain-up compensation is greater than the target level.
It is necessary to target level for the threshold when the signal level after the gain-down compensation is less than the target level.
For example:
One signal level(-15dB), gain-up=5dB, target level=-13dB
After gain compensation, the processed signal should be -10dB but obviously it is greater than the target level.
Because the maximum level is the target level, the the processed signal level will not greater than the target level.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
